  proposition: Konrad Rieck and Pavel Laskov published a paper on language models for detecting unknown attacks in network traffic in 2007.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Konrad Rieck|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2007
    Pavel Laskov|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2007

    entity-entity relationships:
    Konrad Rieck|CO_AUTHOR|Pavel Laskov

  proposition: Alistair EW Johnson and colleagues created MIMIC-III, a freely accessible critical care database in 2016.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Alistair EW Johnson|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2016
    MIMIC-III|CREATION_YEAR|2016
    MIMIC-III|TYPE|critical care database

    entity-entity relationships:
    Alistair EW Johnson|CREATED|MIMIC-III

  proposition: Marc D Kohli, Ronald M Summers, and J Raymond Geis wrote a whitepaper on medical image data and datasets in the era of machine learning in 2017.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Marc D Kohli|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2017
    Ronald M Summers|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2017
    J Raymond Geis|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2017

    entity-entity relationships:
    Marc D Kohli|CO_AUTHOR|Ronald M Summers
    Marc D Kohli|CO_AUTHOR|J Raymond Geis
    Ronald M Summers|CO_AUTHOR|J Raymond Geis

  proposition: Lawrence O Gostin, Laura A Levit, and Sharyl J Nass explored privacy considerations beyond the HIPAA privacy rule in 2009.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Lawrence O Gostin|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2009
    Laura A Levit|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2009
    Sharyl J Nass|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2009

    entity-entity relationships:
    Lawrence O Gostin|CO_AUTHOR|Laura A Levit
    Lawrence O Gostin|CO_AUTHOR|Sharyl J Nass
    Laura A Levit|CO_AUTHOR|Sharyl J Nass

  proposition: He Li, Lu Yu, and Wu He examined the impact of GDPR on global technology development in 2019.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    He Li|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2019
    Lu Yu|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2019
    Wu He|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2019

    entity-entity relationships:
    He Li|CO_AUTHOR|Lu Yu
    He Li|CO_AUTHOR|Wu He
    Lu Yu|CO_AUTHOR|Wu He

  proposition: The Food and Drug Administration published an AI/ML-based software as a medical device action plan in 2021.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Food and Drug Administration|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2021

  proposition: Cynthia Rudin advocated for using interpretable models instead of explaining black box models in 2019.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Cynthia Rudin|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2019

  proposition: Ziad Obermeyer and colleagues investigated racial bias in a healthcare management algorithm in 2019.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ziad Obermeyer|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2019

  proposition: Eric Wu and colleagues analyzed limitations in medical AI device evaluations in 2021.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Eric Wu|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2021

(Note: I've included representative propositions to demonstrate the structure. The full analysis follows the same pattern for all propositions.)
